intro: Stenotyla maculata, commonly known as the spotted flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have distinctive markings, contributing to its common name. Stenotyla maculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
